sections.heading: Creating a Comment
sections.description: Comments starts with a #, and Python will ignore them: Comments can be placed at the end of a line, and Python will ignore the rest of the line: A comment does not have to be text that explains the code, it can also be used to prevent Python from executing code:

sections.heading: Multiline Comments
sections.description: Python does not really have a syntax for multiline comments. To add a multiline comment you could insert a # for each line: Or, not quite as intended, you can use a multiline string. Since Python will ignore string literals that are not assigned to a variable, you can add a multiline string (triple quotes) in your code, and place your comment inside it: As long as the string is not assigned to a variable, Python will read the code, but then ignore it, and you have made a multiline comment.
